byline.original: By ALAN WONG and MICHAEL FORSYTHE

abstract: Hong Kong government asks court to disqualify four additional legislators, escalating conflict over pro-independence politicians' oaths of office; ruling in favor of government could decimate ranks of pro-democracy lawmakers and defy will of voters; would also represent radical breach of  of 'one country, two systems' principle that has helped Hong Kong maintain autonomy since 1997.

headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Government Seeks to Remove 4 More Lawmakers Over Oath-Taking
headline.main: Hong Kong Government Seeks to Remove 4 More Lawmakers From Office

snippet: The leadership filed papers in court arguing that the legislators were ineligible to serve because they had failed to deliver their oaths as prescribed....
lead_paragraph: The leadership filed papers in court arguing that the legislators were ineligible to serve because they had failed to deliver their oaths as prescribed.
